review_title: Decent starting out point for IT
pros:
Interesting projects
Friendly colleagues
Low amount of politics at the lower levels
cons:
Low salary compared to the market rate
Predatory "employee retention schemes" - Bonus is split into two parts, and you're not entitled to bonus if you resign outside of permitted timeframe (which is set by company)
Above average turnover rates
Poor work-life balance (Forced to work on weekends & public holiday)
Poor welfare & benefits (no corporate insurance, low annual leave)
Poor management of resources
Middle management is very poor & lacking
Lack of guidance (but expect deadlines to be adhered to)
Favouritism is widespread
Promote only people of certain nationalities (very little attention is paid to foreigners. Foreigners -- join at your own risk)

pros: Pay is good, nice annual bonus, great colleagues, challenging work, have great mentors and technical consultants who are ready and willing to help and you can learn a lot from them
cons: Can be a bit stressful sometimes due to fast-paced work and need to OT occasionally depends on the nature of the project.

pros: Good hours, friendly colleagues, able to learn alot

review_title: Excellent company in ALL areas except salary and benefits
pros:
Some PM and ROs are extremely capable and can genuinely work with you as a person instead of as just a company headcount.
Can learn a lot both in terms of technical skills and management skills.
Company have very capable technical consultants.
Technical knowledge is freely shared
Help is rendered willingly, positive learning environment
Some capable managers will lead by example and not just give instructions from behind
They give pointers and genuinely want you to grow
Colleagues are very friendly and helpful
Easy to get along with
Very low amount of politics
Company willing to explore technologies and methodologies.
Some projects are still product based rather than building from scratch, depending on client needs
May or may not have work life balance, depending on your project
PM will try their best to give you work life balance as much as possible. But sometimes at a stretch of many months, it is not possible due to resource issue. But they genuinely have your interest at heart and strive for your well being.
cons:
Way below market salary bonus and benefits.
Company announced to be doing well but increment was two digits
SE, SSE and Leads are easily paid better elsewhere.
Understand it's not easy to run a business and make profit but similarly employees also have the future of their aging families to think of...

review_title: Its at best average even on a good day.
pros: Honestly, at first I thought things would get better and I would settle down. But it never happened
cons:
- Not a growing environment
- Pay is too low and work hours are long
- Often need to OT but not compensated
- Turn over here is just too high

pros: Supportive college, always willing to help
cons: Stingy managers, nobody cares about employee benefits and happiness, all they cares about is profits. Promotion are made as a temporary solution only when somebody want to quit. Salary is low, bonus is divided into 3 parts, and you need to stay until October to receiver all of them. Middle level managers are bad, Upper level managers are even worse. No trust between managers and employees.

pros: good work life balance, generally unchallenging
